website_summaries.verdict: A small profile makes this handlebar a good option for smaller road bikes or travel and touring rides.
pros: More narrow than traditional race-oriented handlebars
Provides a comfortable, ergonomically-designed dropbar handle for longer rides and tours
cons: No place to properly route cables

customer_reviews.title: Another winner from FSA
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how much this bar has helped in my aero position. I am a bigger rider, 6', 190 lbs. I wear a 44 coat size an fairly I have broad shoulders so getting a solid aero tuck has always been really difficult for me. This bar allows me more elbow drop and an easier curl in of the shoulders. Who does not love cheating the wind? Traditional bar sizing for me would be a 440 mm wide bar and this bar dropped down to 400 mm wide bar. I am surprised how much I like the compact configuration and the drop is quite comfortable. Bravo again FSA.
customer_reviews.author: 996driver

customer_reviews.title: Salsa Woodchipper II) and these are perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: I have used a few different bars on my Cross Check (Ritchey Logic II and Curve, Salsa Woodchipper II) and these are perfect for me. I am a casual rider (commuting & adventuring), have largish hands (glove size L or XL) and broad shoulders (using the 44cm). I often ride on the hoods and tops for casual riding and commuting but like the drops and hooks for more aggressive riding. This is the first bar that I find equally comfortable in those 4 hand positions and as a result I am spending more time in the drops. At least for my preferences and my riding style, this has become my go-to handlebar.
customer_reviews.author: Micah C.

customer_reviews.title: Eased my neck pain and easier lever access
customer_reviews.text: If you have next pain, you should try these. Slightly more upright in drop position. Also much easier brake lever access for me in drop position.
customer_reviews.author: RickSpeed

customer_reviews.title: Wrapped them with Lizard Skins red/white camo and they look terrific!
customer_reviews.text: Just tried these out this weekend. They are just as others have described. I went with a 42, downsizing from the stock 44's that came on my Colnago. The slightly smaller size fit my shoulders exactly and the bike feels a touch more nimble now. Wrapped them with Lizard Skins red/white camo and they look terrific!
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Best compact drop bars on the market!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I like them so much I got a set for my road bike and a set fory girlfriends road bike. We're not tall, so finding a pair of nice solid drop bars that aren't too wide and are nice and compact is difficult. We rarely use the drops, so I don't need large ones. The reach is perfect and the width is just right. I'm about 5'8", my girlfriend about 5'4". Fits us both great when paired with the correct stem!
customer_reviews.author: Dan W.

customer_reviews.title: Low cost that seems like hundreds were spent
customer_reviews.text: This bar rivals others that cost hundreds of dollars. Have it mounted on my gravel bike and it’s amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Teddy Rivera

customer_reviews.title: New Build
customer_reviews.text: Had a very hard time deciding on bars for my new build. I actually just settled for these ones and planned on replacing them when i found something better. I was surprised when I actually loved these bars! They are incredibly solid and the drops are close and comfortable. I ordered the 40 cm but I got what measured out to be 42 cm. I don't really mind, maybe they sent me the wrong size, but I actually like them and can't even tell without a ruler.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mero

customer_reviews.title: Love the shape
customer_reviews.text: I was using a ergo bar with larger reach and drop, which is lighter, stiffer, more aero, and of course more expensive. Hiwever, what I really like about this fsa compact is the shape, which gives me smooth drops, more comfortable tops, and more clearance between my knees and the handlebars when riding off saddle. Really good handlebars, and I would definitely recommend these. My future upgrade for the handlebars will still be fsa compact for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Hao Sun

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shape of compact bar
customer_reviews.text: With these bars I can ride in the drops all day if needed. A better shape for me than the Pro Vibe compact bar. Light even tough alloy. Stiff.
customer_reviews.author: S. Dryer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: Why did I wait so long to order this handlebar?! It has excellent hand position and very ergonomic.
customer_reviews.author: TRAILWALKER3000

customer_reviews.title: Hey, nice drops!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the shape and depth of the drops on this bar, very comfortable! Not the lightest bar out there, but it is a good value and looks decent.
customer_reviews.author: Saranne Emery

customer_reviews.title: When you want a little better ergonomic for class bar lover
customer_reviews.text: There's no perfect bar period, let me be the first guy to tell you so. if you really like the classic bend of handlebar but you wish you have a little bit more comfort in the drop, the omega compact is the answer. I spent a lot more than in the drop because i am very comfortable using the compact bar, the only part i would like to change is the reach, it's on the short end and i have to get a longer stem to get the extra length. Not a weight weenie bar by any mean, but if you like the classic bar(or hates ergo bar) but you want a better ergonomic, this is the bar you want.
customer_reviews.author: K. lee

customer_reviews.title: Not as decribed
customer_reviews.text: I received my 420mm FSA Omega Compact bars today. The ones I received do not feature "wide groves for easier cable routing" as is specified in the description and pics.
customer_reviews.author: Sanford Barton

customer_reviews.title: They looked great.
customer_reviews.text: I brought these by mistake. I have the older smaller goose neck clamp. They looked great.
customer_reviews.author: DTB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, love the compact drop
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit, love the compact drop, they get the job done for a fraction of the price of some fancy bars or big bike store brands.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M Bania

customer_reviews.title: Great for track bike
customer_reviews.text: I mounted these bars on a Felt TK2 track bike which I use at our local velodrome in Trexlertown, PA. The 38cm width is great for a track bike application (although it might be a little narrow on a road bike). The bend in the bars is such that I do not hit my wrists when jumping out of the saddle for sprints. Also, these bars are very rigid - another nice feature for a track bike application..
customer_reviews.author: Mike P.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for in compact drop bars
customer_reviews.text: These bars seem quite ergonomical and light weight for their price point. Good quality product with plenty of markings to help aid in installation and set-up.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Rolfs

customer_reviews.title: Well-made, light, and compact geometry. The indents ...
customer_reviews.text: Well-made, light, and compact geometry. The indents for the brake cable housing (though not as deep as others I have seen) definitely come in handy when wrapping the bars.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for anyone who loves  a more pleasant ride .
customer_reviews.text: Grate handlebar at a good price . The original on my bike was almost impossible to use efficiently as my arms are short and the drop is deep . On this one I ride the drop effortlessly and the transfar to the hood is easy .
customer_reviews.author: Tibor Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love it feels just as nice as the one on my 3200$ bike.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: ... not a fancy carbon handle bar but its been pretty damn solid for 1
customer_reviews.text: Its not a fancy carbon handle bar but its been pretty damn solid for 1.5 years so far.
customer_reviews.author: C_Unknown

customer_reviews.title: but the handlebars are excellent. You may have to replace your stem if ...
customer_reviews.text: Seller was slow to ship, but the handlebars are excellent. You may have to replace your stem if your currently using Bontreger handlebars.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph K. Boone

customer_reviews.title: Must buy
customer_reviews.text: I am 5”7 170lbs. I was having shoulder back pains, this was a perfect fit for me, and no more shoulder back pain, very comfortable! Awesome price and for what i was looking for, its a must buy...
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Restrepo

customer_reviews.title: Solid bars.
customer_reviews.text: Good bars, seem sturdy. Wish it had a deeper channel for the cables. Looks good. Compact is more compact than I realized, so make sure its what you want.
customer_reviews.author: randy d

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC Handlebar
customer_reviews.text: This is a FANTASTIC handlebar! What a bargain for a bar that just fits right. I'll be swapping these out on other bikes I have--the bend is exactly right for my anatomy.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa McMullan

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have 40cm shoulders and bought the 40cm! My previous Bontrager race handlebars were 42cm. I know one would generally add a couple centimeters but it wasn't always comfortable to me... Probably having cycled for years on my fathers 34 year old Raleigh Pursuit. Anyway, very ergonomic, more comfortable in the palms and a short reach on the hoods! I don't think I would consider another handlebar. Buy them! Ps: I wish they put some marking indication for the hoods, no big deal. I just used a tape cloth tape measurer to ensure the hoods where at equal distance from the end of the bars up to the hoods.
customer_reviews.author: JWillikers

customer_reviews.title: Ehhhh......
customer_reviews.text: Compact bars that fit small hands. For the price this is a great set of bars, but I would go with carbon if you're going to be riding rough roads.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: light and stiff
customer_reviews.text: These bars are great. Affordable, pretty light, and very stiff. Great size selection, comfortable shallow drop. I don't know what else to write amazon, your policy for having long reviews is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Ivar Tenes

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. You will need a stem that fits the diameter. I learned the hard way... Which tought me a lot about life. Great product, cheers
customer_reviews.author: Lars

customer_reviews.title: but it's marginal by my super scientific comparison method
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a set of 3T Ergonova's that were taco'd in a crash. They're probably slightly heavier, but it's marginal by my super scientific comparison method. The fit is great and they're quite comfortable on my Cervelo R3. My only complaint is that there are no markers on the bars for your shifters. You'll have to find a way to measure it to get them both level on the bar.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: good handling, comfortable in the drops, super smooth, great value for money :) would definatly suggest these bars to others
customer_reviews.author: Brandon bardsley

customer_reviews.title: Changed my life.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a short guy with smallish hands. Ergo bar drops never really worked well for me. Put this bar on and now I can descend like Pantani. Oh, and now I can reach my brakes. Not that I need them or anything... sheeet.
customer_reviews.author: James E.

customer_reviews.title: but comfortable riding on the hoods or in the drops
customer_reviews.text: A little pricey, but comfortable riding on the hoods or in the drops!
customer_reviews.author: DSA

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Nearly perfect for an affordable compact handlebar. Comfortable on the hands with lots of contact and easy reach to the shifters. these bars will greatly increase your comfort and time spent in the drops.
customer_reviews.author: Mass Observer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome handlebar!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome handlebar for the money. I wanted a narrower handlebar to be more tucked in my riding position. This handlebar replaced a 44cm FSA handlebar and it delivered. Comfortable layout and bends. Good ergonomics.
customer_reviews.author: Cochise

product_meta.title: FSA Omega Compact Road Handlebar
product_meta.description: FSA's Omega Compact Road Handlebar lets you upgrade your cyclocross or training bike without making you spend a fortune. The Omega Compact is built with 6066-series aluminum tubing that is double-butted, tapered, shot-peened, and features wide grooves for easier cable routing. And with drops that flare out 10mm relative to the hoods, the Omega's compact measurements improves reach and offers you a more ergonomically-friendly position on the bars.
feature_bullets: FSA road handlebars are measured from center to center of the drops
FSA sl-k RNUMxRNUMT stem was constructed to provide rigid support for the handlebars, feeling similar in both weight and stiffness
